intro: Psychotria banahaensis var. montalbanensis, commonly known as the Montalban psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Philippines, specifically found in the mountainous regions of Luzon. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically in lowland to mid-elevation forests. The species is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
